answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
From my experience I think it works best to have an employee on site during the project.  Too many different issues come up, someone usually gets called out.  In your rfp limit work to a certain number of days and work with an employee to flex or modify shift, sometimes this can work out better for everyone.  As it relates to painting we have worked with jail huber inmates (painters) to assist with special county facility projects.

text: I am prepairing a scope of work for an open bid for painting the interior of City Hall. Has anyone put together a similar scope dealing with after hours work, and furniture moving issues? If so would you mind sharing.  Thanks.
